job_description: Junior Data Scientist - job post Studio X 12 reviews Austin, TX • Remote Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time General Overview Studio X is a global innovation studio accelerating the pace of energy innovation, by harnessing the spirit of innovation, collaboration, community, and a passion for pursuing what's possible. With Studio X, people are able to come together from around the world to transform the way energy innovation works. Together we can equip top talent with cutting-edge tools, data, and resources from one of the world's largest companies in order to disrupt a multi-trillion dollar industry. Currently, Studio X is comprised of three distinct offerings: XCover offers new ways of utilizing technology and talent to solve complex energy problems. We create pathways to accelerate results for energy projects, and enable innovation to go further, faster. Xeek unleashes our data science community to solve difficult energy challenges. Working with Xeek gives you exposure to thousands of different experiences and perspectives from around the world that are simply not available in any one company. SixLa b is a startup accelerator focused on energy innovation. Participants can leverage the skills and experience of the Studio X community, the tools and platform of Xeek, and the AI/ML innovation from our core data and geoscience teams. What You'll Do The Xeek Data Scientist will support the development and launching of data science challenges on the Xeek platform. In this role, you will work with stakeholders to understand their requirements for a challenge and how to communicate it to a community of data scientists. Your insights and skills will be needed in maturing challenges toward launch, ensuring that the end products of a challenge meet the stakeholders desired outcomes and that the challenges are engaging for the Xeek Community. This role needs the ability to pick up new technical disciplines and data types, good attention to detail, and communication skills to be successful. This role will report to the Director of Xeek. Your responsibilities will include: Help define and uncover the scope of a challenge through discussions with stakeholders Work with Xeek Engineers and Data Scientists to ensure that the elements for a challenge are robust and ready for timely launches. Develop of multiple challenges at different levels of maturity Help communicate with the Xeek Community through forum discussions and support tickets. Find new and creative ways to introduce data and concepts to stakeholders and Community members. What You'll Bring A minimum of 5 years of experience working in a role where your primary responsibility was building machine learning models Ability to quickly pick up new technologies and scientific disciplines Self-starter - can make progress independently A strong background in data science as well as fluency in Python Excellent collaboration for engaging both internal and external stakeholders Communicate effectively to deliver requirements for product and engineering teams Additional Attributes Experience solving complex problems for stakeholders AWS experience, especially SageMaker Ability to prototype ideas from different scientific disciplines quickly Work experience with Python. Other languages are a plus Clear documentation background Education MS/PhD degree or equivalent practical experience. BS minimum Time Commitment / Travel Requirements Full-time Preferred location: Austin, Remote for the right candidate Up to 25% travel may be required If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Data Scientist - job post Signature Science, LLC 24 reviews Austin, TX 78759 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Position Purpose: The successful candidate will be based in our Austin, TX facility and will support numerous research & development and test & evaluation projects related to defense, forensics, and national security. The candidate will be based in our Austin, TX headquarters within the Quality Assurance & Data Science Business Area. The candidate must be motivated to contribute in a team environment, collaborate across multiple scientific and technical disciplines, and be excited to develop new skills. The candidate must have the flexibility to balance multiple on-going tasks while operating efficiently with minimal supervision. As needed, the candidate should be able to direct others to accomplish project tasks. The candidate must be detail oriented and be able to appropriately document their work. Job functions will include performing data analytics and statistical analyses, training and optimizing machine learning and predictive models, generating visualizations, and developing automated data processing pipelines on chemical, biological, radio frequency (RF), visual (imagery), and text-based data. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Performs data analytics, specifically data clean-up, data processing, machine learning modeling, statistical analysis, multivariate data analysis, and/or data visualization, as related to scientific data. Applies technical skills to plan and execute assigned project work including development of data pre-processing routines, data summarizations, data visualizations and plotting, development and application of machine learning and artificial intelligence models, development of detection algorithms, and development and deployment automated processing pipelines. Maintains operational capabilities of computational assets as needed by project requirements. Leads meetings with company clients by preparing and presenting materials in meetings. Appropriately annotates developed computer code/scripts with comments and through user guides/manuals. Performs maintenance and updates of scripts/code for routine data analysis. Presents technical results through the drafting of technical reports and presentation materials. Presents experimental results and recommended actions at internal project meetings. Supports business development efforts as needed by drafting technical sections of proposals, providing proposal review, assessing levels of effort required to complete proposed work, and brainstorming technical solutions to client problems. Other duties as assigned. Performance of all job duties is intended to be completed under limited direct supervision of their supervisor. Required Knowledge,Skills,& Abilities : Required Proficiency in performing data analytics, predictive analytics, machine learning, multivariate data analysis, and data mining as it relates to scientific data Software programming/scripting proficiency in R, Python, Java, and/or MATLAB Experience and proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, and Powerpoint Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities are required Ability to lead group of co-workers in execution of a task Working knowledge of statistics, experimental error, and quantification as it applies to scientific data Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences Competent in using Linux/Unix operating system command line interface Ability to work independently and to interact effectively with individuals on multi-disciplinary teams Team player with a positive attitude Preferred Experience in analytical chemistry or biochemistry including chromatography, mass spectrometry, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, proteomics, metabolomics, RF signal processing, genomics, or other biochemical analysis methods Experience in developing proteomics or metabolomics data analysis pipelines Experience with NextFlow, SnakeMake, or similar workflow/pipeline management systems Experience in developing natural language processing (NLP) and/or machine vision models Previous research and development experience related to chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear, and/or explosive (CBRNE) threats Working knowledge of good software development practices such as version control systems (e.g., Git) and Agile development (e.g., workflows, sprints) Ability to develop and query relational databases (MySQL or similar) Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform, or Microsoft Azure cloud computing Ability to think creatively, demonstrate curiosity, and lead research teams Sufficient business knowledge to support marketing, and bids and proposal efforts Education/Experience: Successful candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, or a related scientific discipline with at least 3-5 years of professional experience; or a Ph.D. or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology, or a related scientific discipline. Successful candidate must have significant experience in software programming/scripting for scientific data analysis and machine learning modeling. Clearance: Candidate must be willing to seek and maintain government security clearance at the SECRET level following hire. Candidates with current DoD SECRET or other clearance will be given preference. Working Conditions/Equipment: Ability to sit for long periods of time at desk/computer. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Data Scientist (Remote in Texas) - job post Central Health 45 reviews Austin, TX 78759 • Remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview: The Data Scientist serves as a resource for operational, performance, and population health analysis for Central Health. Under general direction, the Data Scientist is responsible for organizing, analyzing, and reporting on data from large clinical, financial, and enrollment data sets. This position will develop custom algorithms, predictive and/ or prescriptive models that help to optimize healthcare delivery to our patients. This position will also assist in the design and development of data warehouses, performance dashboards, program evaluation models, and other systems support the needs of an integrated network of physicians, safety net providers and hospitals to advance care that is patient centered and data driven. This position is considered remote, which means that individuals in this position may work at their place of residence; however, they will be required to be on site during the first 90 days as needed and may be required to occasionally visit the Central Health administrative office or health centers in Austin, Texas. Remote work not available for residents of California, New York, New Jersey, Hawaii, Maryland, or Virginia due to local employment laws. Responsibilities: Essential Duties (at least 5 that are non-negotiable duties and are absolutely pertinent to successfully completing the job without accommodations): Build statistical (including predictive) models for various projects that range from program evaluation to population management. Perform quantitative and qualitative data analyses and prepare results to share with internal and external customers. Aid in design and development of data warehouse/data mart applications. Communicate highly technical information to numerous audiences including internal and external stakeholders and the community. Undertake complex data integration activities. Identify and troubleshoot data anomalies and irregularities. Prepare written and oral reports that communicate necessary information to internal and external customers. Produce and streamline as needed ongoing monthly, quarterly and annual reports in support of Central Health. Become a data subject matter expert (SME) and understand various sources and applications of Central Health data. Performs other duties as assigned. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, optimization, clustering, decision trees, random forests, etc.). Experience using statistical computer languages to build efficient models. Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving skills. Keen understanding of data structure/ data architecture. Ability to manipulate data using SQL in SSMS environment. Familiarity with healthcare data from multiple sources including claims and EHR data. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects with varying deadlines. Compliance with data confidentiality and security procedures. Experience with Microsoft Office applications specifically MS Word, MS Excel and MS Outlook. Ability to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas as indicated by audience. Knowledge of healthcare, including medical claims coding, relationships between health plans, providers, and payers, a plus. Qualifications: MINIMUM EDUCATION: Master’s in Biostatistics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field PREFERRED EDUCATION: PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field MINIMUM EXPERIENCE: 2 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, including predictive models 1 year of experience with healthcare data 2 years of experience with R scripting 2 years of experience with SQL coding PREFERRED EXPERIENCE: Experience with programming or scripting languages such as Python, Julia, MATLAB, Python, C++ Experience with Tableau data visualization tool Experience with REDCap data repository Experience with Java Experience with MS Excel
